storyTitle: As Attendance Auditor, I want to review attendance data validation reports to achieve data accuracy

testCases.title: Validate generation of attendance validation reports
preconditions: User is logged in as an authorized Attendance Auditor
Attendance data exists in the system for the selected date range
Validation rules are configured in the system
Network connectivity is stable

steps.action: Navigate to the validation reports module from the main dashboard
steps.expectedResult: Report generation interface is displayed with filter options including date range, employee, and department fields

steps.action: Select a date range using the date picker (e.g., last 30 days)
steps.expectedResult: Date range is selected and displayed in the date fields without errors

steps.action: Select specific department from the department dropdown filter
steps.expectedResult: Department filter is applied and displayed correctly

steps.action: Click the 'Generate Report' button
steps.expectedResult: System processes the request and generates the validation report within 10 seconds, displaying a list of anomalies including missing punches, duplicate entries, and validation errors with employee details

steps.action: Review the generated report for anomalies and recommendations
steps.expectedResult: Report displays all detected anomalies with clear descriptions, affected employees, dates, and actionable recommendations for corrections

postconditions: Validation report is successfully generated and displayed
Report generation time is logged in system metrics
User remains on the validation reports page

testCases.title: Test report export functionality
preconditions: User is logged in as an authorized Attendance Auditor
A validation report has been generated and is displayed on screen
Browser allows file downloads
Sufficient storage space available for downloads

steps.action: Generate a validation report by selecting date range and clicking 'Generate Report'
steps.expectedResult: Validation report is displayed on screen with anomalies, employee details, and recommendations

steps.action: Click the 'Export as PDF' button
steps.expectedResult: PDF file is generated and downloaded successfully to the default download location with filename format 'Validation_Report_YYYY-MM-DD.pdf'

steps.action: Open the downloaded PDF file
steps.expectedResult: PDF opens correctly displaying all report data including headers, anomalies, employee information, and recommendations in a readable format

steps.action: Return to the validation report screen and click the 'Export as CSV' button
steps.expectedResult: CSV file is generated and downloaded successfully to the default download location with filename format 'Validation_Report_YYYY-MM-DD.csv'

steps.action: Open the downloaded CSV file in a spreadsheet application
steps.expectedResult: CSV opens correctly with all report data in structured columns including employee ID, name, date, anomaly type, description, and recommendations

postconditions: PDF and CSV files are successfully downloaded
Export actions are logged in the audit trail
User remains on the validation reports page
Downloaded files contain accurate and complete report data

testCases.title: Ensure access control for validation reports
preconditions: System has role-based access control configured
Test user accounts exist: one unauthorized user and one authorized auditor
Validation reports module is accessible via the application
User is logged out initially

steps.action: Login to the system using credentials of an unauthorized user (e.g., regular employee without auditor role)
steps.expectedResult: User successfully logs into the system and is redirected to their default dashboard

steps.action: Attempt to navigate to the validation reports module by entering the URL or searching for the module
steps.expectedResult: Access to validation reports is denied with an error message 'Access Denied: You do not have permission to view this page' or the module is not visible in the navigation menu

steps.action: Logout from the unauthorized user account
steps.expectedResult: User is successfully logged out and redirected to the login page

steps.action: Login to the system using credentials of an authorized auditor
steps.expectedResult: Auditor successfully logs into the system and is redirected to their dashboard

steps.action: Navigate to the validation reports module from the main menu or dashboard
steps.expectedResult: Access to validation reports is granted and the report generation interface is displayed with all filter options and functionality available

steps.action: Verify that all report features are accessible including generation, filtering, and export options
steps.expectedResult: All validation report features are fully accessible and functional for the authorized auditor

postconditions: Access control is enforced correctly for both authorized and unauthorized users
All access attempts are logged in the security audit trail
Authorized auditor has full access to validation reports functionality
System security remains intact

storyTitle: As Attendance Manager, I want to receive alerts for attendance anomalies to achieve proactive issue resolution

testCases.title: Validate anomaly detection and alert generation
preconditions: User is logged in as an Attendance Manager
Anomaly detection business rules are configured in the system
Email notification service is configured and operational
Test attendance data with known anomalies is prepared for injection
Manager's email address is registered in the system

steps.action: Inject attendance data containing known anomalies (e.g., missing punch-out, duplicate entries, irregular hours) into the system
steps.expectedResult: Test data is successfully inserted into the attendance database

steps.action: Trigger the automated anomaly detection process or wait for the scheduled daily run
steps.expectedResult: System runs anomaly detection algorithms and processes the attendance data within 1 hour

steps.action: Verify that alerts are generated for each detected anomaly
steps.expectedResult: System generates alerts for all injected anomalies with unique alert IDs and timestamps

steps.action: Navigate to the manager dashboard and check the alerts section
steps.expectedResult: Alerts are visible in the dashboard with correct details including employee name, date, anomaly type, description, and severity level

steps.action: Click on an individual alert to view detailed information
steps.expectedResult: Alert details page displays comprehensive information including affected employee, date/time of anomaly, specific issue description, and recommended corrective actions

steps.action: Check the email inbox of the attendance manager
steps.expectedResult: Email notifications are received containing accurate alert information including employee details, anomaly type, date, and a link to view the alert in the system

steps.action: Verify the content and formatting of the email notification
steps.expectedResult: Email is properly formatted with clear subject line, alert details, and actionable information matching the dashboard alert

postconditions: All anomalies are detected and alerts are generated
Alerts are visible in the manager dashboard
Email notifications are successfully delivered
Alert generation is logged in the system
Alerts remain in 'New' status awaiting manager action

testCases.title: Test alert acknowledgment and resolution
preconditions: User is logged in as an Attendance Manager
At least one unacknowledged alert exists in the system
Audit logging is enabled and functional
Manager has permissions to acknowledge and resolve alerts

steps.action: Navigate to the alert dashboard and locate an unacknowledged alert
steps.expectedResult: Alert dashboard displays the list of alerts with status indicators showing 'New' or 'Unacknowledged'

steps.action: Click on the alert to open the alert details page
steps.expectedResult: Alert details page opens displaying full information about the anomaly and available actions

steps.action: Click the 'Acknowledge' button on the alert
steps.expectedResult: Alert status changes to 'Acknowledged', timestamp is recorded, and a confirmation message is displayed

steps.action: Verify the alert status in the dashboard list view
steps.expectedResult: Alert now shows 'Acknowledged' status with the manager's name and acknowledgment timestamp

steps.action: Return to the alert details and review the recommended corrective actions
steps.expectedResult: Corrective action recommendations are clearly displayed with steps to resolve the anomaly

steps.action: After taking corrective action (simulated or actual), click the 'Mark as Resolved' button
steps.expectedResult: Alert status changes to 'Resolved', resolution timestamp is recorded, and a confirmation message is displayed

steps.action: Add resolution notes in the comments field and save
steps.expectedResult: Resolution notes are saved and associated with the alert record

steps.action: Navigate to the audit log section and search for the alert ID
steps.expectedResult: Audit log displays entries for alert creation, acknowledgment, and resolution with timestamps, manager name, and actions taken

steps.action: Verify that all alert activities are properly logged
steps.expectedResult: Audit log contains complete trail including: alert generation time, acknowledgment time and user, resolution time and user, and any comments or notes added

postconditions: Alert status is updated to 'Resolved'
All alert activities are logged in the audit trail
Resolution notes are saved and retrievable
Alert is moved to resolved alerts section
Audit log is complete and accurate

testCases.title: Ensure access control for alert management
preconditions: System has role-based access control configured for alert management
Test user accounts exist: one unauthorized user and one attendance manager
Active alerts exist in the system
User is logged out initially

steps.action: Login to the system using credentials of an unauthorized user (e.g., regular employee or auditor without manager role)
steps.expectedResult: User successfully logs into the system and is redirected to their role-appropriate dashboard

steps.action: Attempt to navigate to the alert dashboard by entering the URL directly or searching for the module
steps.expectedResult: Access to alert dashboard is denied with an error message 'Access Denied: You do not have permission to view alerts' or the alert module is not visible in the navigation

steps.action: Attempt to access alert notifications or email links as an unauthorized user
steps.expectedResult: System prevents access and displays appropriate authorization error message

steps.action: Logout from the unauthorized user account
steps.expectedResult: User is successfully logged out and redirected to the login page

steps.action: Login to the system using credentials of an authorized attendance manager
steps.expectedResult: Attendance manager successfully logs into the system and is redirected to their dashboard

steps.action: Navigate to the alert dashboard from the main menu
steps.expectedResult: Access to alert dashboard is granted and the interface displays all active alerts with full details

steps.action: Verify that alert notifications are visible in the dashboard notification area
steps.expectedResult: Alert notifications are displayed with count badge and recent alerts summary

steps.action: Verify access to all alert management features including acknowledge, resolve, and comment functions
steps.expectedResult: All alert management features are fully accessible and functional for the authorized attendance manager

steps.action: Check that email notifications are being received by the manager's registered email
steps.expectedResult: Email notifications are successfully delivered to the attendance manager's inbox

postconditions: Access control is properly enforced for both authorized and unauthorized users
All access attempts are logged in the security audit trail
Authorized attendance manager has full access to alert dashboard and notifications
Unauthorized users cannot view or manipulate alerts
System security and data integrity remain intact

storyTitle: As Attendance Manager, I want to generate attendance summary reports to achieve workforce insights

testCases.title: Validate attendance summary report generation
preconditions: User is logged in as an authorized Attendance Manager
Attendance database contains valid attendance records for multiple employees and departments
System is connected to the attendance database
Browser supports PDF and Excel file downloads
User has appropriate role-based permissions to access attendance reports module

steps.action: Navigate to the attendance reports module from the main dashboard
steps.expectedResult: Report interface is displayed with options to select report parameters including employee, department, and date range filters

steps.action: Select a specific department from the department dropdown
steps.expectedResult: Department is selected and displayed in the filter section

steps.action: Select a date range (e.g., last 30 days) using the date picker
steps.expectedResult: Date range is selected and displayed in the filter section

steps.action: Click the 'Generate Report' button
steps.expectedResult: System processes the request and generates the report within 10 seconds. Report displays accurate data including total hours, absences, and late arrivals with graphical visualizations such as charts and graphs

steps.action: Review the generated report data and verify metrics accuracy against source data
steps.expectedResult: All metrics (total hours, absences, late arrivals) match the attendance database records. Graphical visualizations accurately represent the data

steps.action: Click the 'Export as PDF' button
steps.expectedResult: PDF file downloads successfully to the default download location. File opens correctly and contains all report data, metrics, and visualizations with proper formatting

steps.action: Click the 'Export as Excel' button
steps.expectedResult: Excel file downloads successfully to the default download location. File opens correctly in Excel with all report data in structured format, including separate sheets for data and visualizations if applicable

postconditions: Attendance summary report is successfully generated and displayed
PDF and Excel files are downloaded and saved to local system
Report generation is logged in system audit trail
User remains on the reports interface for further actions

testCases.title: Ensure access control for attendance reports
preconditions: System has role-based access control configured
Test user accounts exist: one unauthorized user (e.g., regular employee) and one authorized manager
Attendance reports module requires manager-level permissions
Both user accounts have valid credentials

steps.action: Navigate to the login page and enter credentials for an unauthorized user (regular employee without manager role)
steps.expectedResult: User is successfully authenticated and logged into the system

steps.action: Attempt to navigate to the attendance reports module by entering the URL directly or clicking on reports menu if visible
steps.expectedResult: Access to the attendance reports module is denied. System displays an error message such as 'Access Denied: You do not have permission to view this page' or redirects to unauthorized access page

steps.action: Verify that the attendance reports menu option is not visible in the navigation for unauthorized user
steps.expectedResult: Attendance reports module link is not displayed in the navigation menu for unauthorized user

steps.action: Logout from the unauthorized user account
steps.expectedResult: User is successfully logged out and redirected to the login page

steps.action: Navigate to the login page and enter credentials for an authorized manager account
steps.expectedResult: Manager is successfully authenticated and logged into the system

steps.action: Navigate to the attendance reports module from the main dashboard or navigation menu
steps.expectedResult: Access to the attendance reports module is granted. Report interface is displayed with all available options including parameter selection, report generation, and export functionality

steps.action: Verify that all report features are accessible including filters, generate button, and export options
steps.expectedResult: All attendance report features are fully accessible and functional for the authorized manager

postconditions: Unauthorized user access attempt is logged in security audit trail
Authorized manager has full access to attendance reports module
Role-based access control is validated and functioning correctly
No unauthorized data access occurred during testing
